documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: a reminder of today 's main news :
i 'm signing off until 08:00 tomorrow , but the page will be automatically updated with any major cumbrian news overnight .
if you 've got a story or a photo you 'd like to share , you can email us , tweet @ twitterid or get in touch using facebook .
have a very good evening .
author: Martin Lewes

documents.title: cumbria police opens search for new bobbies
text: cumbria police has opened a new recruitment campaign for new officers .
the police and crime commissioner , peter mccall , says he wants to increase the number of officers , and he 's proposed an increase in his share of the council tax to pay for it .
recruitment evenings are being held around the county next week , and you can find more information here .

documents.title: boys 'brutally ' raped girl in field
text: boys 'brutally ' raped girl in field

documents.title: where there once was a hole : rail line open again
text: network rail engineers have completed repairs to a sink hole that opened up beneath the tracks at harrington , between workington and whitehaven .
the hole , which was 2ft across and about 4ft deep , formed after storm eleanor .
the engineers say such sink holes are rare on railways , with only 50 in the past five years on the whole network .

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : cold and murky
text: cloud will increase from the south across cumbria this evening , leading to a cloudy , murky night , although some clear spells are possible in the north .
it will be cold and locally frosty overnight , with the risk of patchy drizzle or light hill snow , and fog over the hills .
the lowest temperatures will be about -2c ( 28f ) .
you can find the latest bbc weather forecast for where you are , here .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: bombed navy vessel found after 77 years
text: bombed navy vessel found after 77 years

documents.title: chinese collector 'bidding for merz barn ' , say trustees
text: the trust that has been trying to create a centre about the artist kurt schwitters , who spent his final years living in the lake district , is in financial difficulties and may sell the woodland where he turned a barn into his final big work .

ian hunter , director of the littoral trust , told a gathering at the weekend that was marking the 70th anniversary of the artist 's death that time was running out and his partner , celia larner , had sold property to keep the trust going .

schwitters died in poverty in kendal workhouse , and in the 1960s the wall that he 'd plastered with cement and various found objects as an artistic installation was removed to a newcastle gallery to save it from decay .
mr hunter said he 'd been approached on behalf of a chinese collector who wanted to create a sculpture park , to offer to buy the woodland and the barn .
the trust was funded by the arts council england until 2011 , to the tune of almost £ 400,000 , but in 2016 a senior official said future funding was unlikely .
author: Martin Lewes
Reporter

text: sensors aid lake district ice climbers

documents.title: hospitals chief praised as she announces departure
text: tributes are being paid to dame jackie daniel , the chief executive of the morecambe bay hospitals trust , who has announced she will leave the job in march .

james titcombe led the campaign that exposed the furness general hospital maternity scandal , after which dame jackie was brought in to sort out problems at the hospitals in barrow , lancaster and kendal .
jackie has done an absolutely amazing job . ''
the barrow and furness mp john woodcock said dame jackie had led a change programme that left the hospitals stronger and better prepared for `` for a funding crisis imposed by the government . ''
dame jackie has done a great job turning round our hospitals at a very challenging time . ''
sad news for @ twitterid - @ twitterid has been a superb chief exec whom i 'm sure will continue to make a difference in the nhs .
best wishes for the future jackie & thank you for all you have done .
dear james i totally agree with you she is super chief executive i wish her good luck .
big challenge for morecambe bay now is making sure jackie 's replacement has the same principles , courage and values .

documents.title: four boys accused of 'gang rape ' of girl , 15
text: four boys , all under 16 years old , have gone on trial at carlisle crown court accused of raping a 15-year-old girl in workington a year ago .
all deny two charges of rape and one of sexual assault after they met the girl , to whom they were said to be `` total strangers '' .
the boys , all from the west cumbria area , claim what took place was all with the girl 's complete consent .
but tim evans , prosecuting , told the court that a `` pack mentality '' had taken over , with the boys taking turns to rape the girl .
the trial continues

documents.title: travel : roadworks slow traffic on a69
text: there are delays on the a69 through warwick bridge at roadworks .
there are also delays at temporary traffic lights in dalston , on the carlisle road .

documents.title: cumbrian radio stations rebranded by new owner
text: two commercial radio stations serving south cumbria are being relaunched as part of national networks by their new owner .
the bay and lakeland , both originally established as local stations , were sold by cnn to the media firm global .

today global said the bay would become part of the heart network , which has 9.5 million listeners across the country , while lakeland would join the smooth network , which has 5.7 million listeners .

documents.title: hard frost lines morecambe bay shore with ice
text: it was a hard frost last night , and here 's one result , ice along the tideline of morecambe bay , near aldingham .
ian ally was out early and sent us this photo , saying it was a very cold morning : `` 0c on the car but i would imagine at least -6c including the wind chill . ''
if you 've a photo you 'd like to share , you can email us , tweet @ twitterid or get in touch using facebook .

however , cloud will arrive from the south later and the winds will strengthen , with a maximum temperature of 4c ( 39

documents.title: power cut blacks out sedbergh
text: electricity north west engineers are working on a power fault that has blacked out 276 homes and businesses in sedbergh .

documents.title: county council comes out against thirlmere zip wire scheme
text: cumbria county council has joined objectors to controversial plans for two sets of zip wires across thirlmere .

the wires , carrying four participants in each direction , would cross over the a591 , the main north-south route through the lake district , and the county 's comment says drivers would be distracted .

in a letter to planners at the lake district national park authority , andrew harrison from the county council says the examples given by the developers , treetop treks , of other aerial attractions crossing highways are not comparable .
this friday is the dealdine for comments on the plan to be submitted .
the safety of all users , including visitors and cyclist , not familiar with the area , will be severely impacted by this proposal . ''

documents.title: 'degenerate ' artist commemorated
text: 'degenerate ' artist commemorated

documents.title: new strikes in railway guards row
text: pickets were outside railway stations in cumbria today on the first of three days of strikes this week in the long-running row between the rmt union and northern over the role of guards on trains .
northern says about 66 % of services across the region will run , and others may be replaced by buses .

the rmt union says changing the role of guards and allowing some trains to run without them , would not be safe , but they are prepared to discuss `` operational models '' used in wales and scotland .
northern says services run without guards on other lines , and if it was unsafe , the independent rail regulator would not allow them to run trains .

we could n't make any changes without making sure the appropriate risk assessments were put in place and any mitigations to risks that were identified were addressed , because we would n't have a licence to operate . ''

documents.title: highlights : carlisle united 0-0 sheffield wednesday
text: highlights : carlisle united 0-0 sheffield wednesday

documents.title: hospitals chief steps down one week after honour
text: the chief executive of the morecambe bat hospitals trust has announced she 's stepping down , one week after she was made a dame in the new year honours list .
dame jackie daniel was brought in to run the trust in 2012 after the furness general hospital maternity scandal and a number of highly critical reports .
dame jackie , who began her career as a nurse , said that after five-and-a-half years she felt it was time to pursue other interests .
she will finish at the end of march .

documents.title: nuclear site firefighters to strike
text: nuclear site firefighters to strike

documents.title: water engineers dealing with leak in grange
text: united utilities says its engineers are working on a water mains leak in a field near grange-over-sands that has caused supply problems in homes in the area .

documents.title: name sought as 'trauma teddy ' joins police response team
text: people are being asked to help name cumbria police 's newest recruit in barrow - a cuddly toy known as a trauma teddy .
gill ainsley , a local knitter , donated the toy to the police after hearing how other forces take similar toys to the scene of incidents where children are present .
officers in barrow plan to adopt the bear and take it on patrol .

documents.title: ministers order new search for nuclear waste store
text: the search for somewhere to store the uk 's radioactive waste permanently will start again this year .

most of britain 's nuclear waste is already stored at sellafield or the nearby drigg repository ( and the cumbria has always been high of the list of potential sites as a result , although geological surveys are less favourable than other areas .

previous searches have focused on storage deep underground ; cumbria county council vetoed a search for a site in the county five years ago after several years of consideration , effectively blocking support for the idea from allerdale and copeland .
but in 2013 , ministers changed the guidelines , so no single level of local government had such a veto , and this year , a new survey will begin .

documents.title: travel : corney fell road closed because of ice
text: the corney fell road between broughton and calder bridge is closed because of icy conditions .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: weather on the fell tops : summits now in full winter condition
text: the lake district weatherline report says exposed routes like striding edge should now be attempted only by people experienced in , and equipped for , winter mountaineering .

documents.title: sellafield fire fighters union calls new strike in pay row
text: the union representing fire fighters at the sellafield plant has called two new one-day strikes in a long-running dispute over pay .
a gmb official , chris jukes , said a new pay offer last month was not enough to resolve the row .
sellafield limited has put alternative arrangements in place on previous strike days .

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : cold and frosty , then cold and sunny
text: it 'll be a cold and frosty start to the day but dry and fine with plenty of sunshine .
temperatures will probably not rise much above 3c ( 37f ) .
you can find the latest bbc weather forecast for cumbria , here .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: staffie stolen in whitehaven burglary
text: the police say a dog was stolen from a home in whitehaven at the weekend .
a black and white staffordshire bull terrier called rex was taken after someone forced their way into a garden on moresby park and took the dog from a kennel .
the theft happened overnight on saturday .

documents.title: engineers called in as water pressure drops
text: the water company united utilities say it 's investigating reports of water supply problems in the ca4 and ca2 postcode areas in carlisle .

documents.title: travel : trains disrupted by guards row strike
text: strikes by the rmt union will affect northern train services today and on wednesday and friday .
northern says it will run about 66 % of services between 07:00 and 19:00 , and some services will be replaced with buses .
you can check on services from your local station here .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: travel : delays follow lorry fire on a66
text: there will be delays for the first several hours of the morning on the a66 east of penrith , near the centre parcs entrance , in both directions , where temporary traffic lights have been installed to allow recovery work after a lorry fire .
author: BBC News Travel
